paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its variants, particularly focusing on the TTRL55P mutation associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR amyloidosis).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: To this end, we employed TALEN-mediated gene editing to manipulate an iPSC line derived from a patient with the Leu55→Pro (TTRL55P) mutation, one of the most proteotoxic disease-causing variants.

functional_data.summary: The TTRL55P variant leads to destabilization of the TTR protein, promoting amyloid fibril formation.
assays: liquid chromatography combined with mass spectrometry (LC-MS)

variants.segregation_data: The TTRL55P variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the pathogenic nature of the TTRL55P variant in ATTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR amyloidosis) is an autosomal dominant disorder that can result from over 100 described mutations in the transthyretin (TTR) gene.
expression of the most proteotoxic TTR variant in HLCs correlates with expression of genes inversely implicated in the toxic aggregation of TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the TTR variant.
